title: Explain this bullshit
body: Played League of Legends about a week or two ago with no issues. Internet is working perfectly fine. I get into a game, and get this shit. Does anyone wanna explain what the fuckery this is?

replies.body:
It appears your client was unable to establish a good link to the game server. This could be caused by a number of reasons, however, the most common are local network configurations that conflict with League. As a first step, I encourage you to work through the steps in our [connection troubleshooting guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) to ensure your network settings are compatible with League.

Let me know if those steps caused any change.

i had this same issue a while back. I've played LOL since season 2 and never had any problems playing on the same computer then one day this happened. I had the same problem after playing back to back games. I would turn my computer off and then on again and the problem would be gone. Then one day it just stopped. I think that this might be a problem with the game itself on some pcs.

Happens a lot to me, too. [Happened in my Silver Promos](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/EuMWZYRG-game-crashed-silver-promos-one-loss-feelsgood), got a loss because of it, and sadly and with salt, I tried to win the rest of my promos.

Got into Silver, but still a bit salty. I'd honestly like to know what's up, too.
